poem:
### The Soup Strike

In the heart of a painting, a splash,  
a canvas baptized in protest,  
where sunflowers shiver in oils' echo,  
their petals whispering crisis.  
Acts of art become arsenal—  
a clash of colors in the gallery hall  
as minds question the fossil-fueled core,  
wondering if soup can awaken the soil.
